alert.note: Alert for Hendricks; Johnson; Morgan; Owen; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 12:31PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Shelby, Hancock, Morgan, Johnson, southeastern Hendricks, northeastern Owen, Marion and southern Hamilton Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Zionsville to 9 miles north of Spencer. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Carmel around 1240 PM EDT. Fishers and Martinsville around 1250 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Indianapolis, Lawrence and Franklin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 92 and 127. Interstate 69 between mile markers 200 and 203. Interstate 70 between mile markers 50 and 105. Interstate 74 between mile markers 67 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for central, south central and west central Indiana.
